                                      # 3.3. æ¡ˆä¾‹

                                      // éœ€æ±‚ï¼šåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªCollectioné›†åˆå­˜å‚¨å­¦ç”Ÿå¯¹è±¡çš„é›†åˆï¼Œå­˜å‚¨3ä¸ªå­¦ç”Ÿå¯¹è±¡ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ç¨‹åºå®ç°åœ¨æ§åˆ¶å°éå†è¯¥é›†åˆ

// ----------Studentç±»--------------------
public class Student{
    private String name;
    private int age;

    public Student() {
    }

    public Student(String name, int age) {
        this.name = name;
        this.age = age;
    }

    public String getName() {
        return name;
    }

    public void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }

    public int getAge() {
        return age;
    }

    public void setAge(int age) {
        this.age = age;
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "Student{" +
                "name='" + name + '\'' +
                ", age=" + age +
                '}';
    }
}


// ----------Testç±»--------------------
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Iterator;

public class test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ArrayList<Student> list = new ArrayList<>();

        Student s1 = new Student("å¼ ä¸‰", 23);
        Student s2 = new Student("æå››", 16);
        Student s3 = new Student("ç‹äº”", 31);
        list.add(s1);
        list.add(s2);
        list.add(s3);

        // è¿­ä»£å™¨éå†
        Iterator<Student> it = list.iterator();
        while (it.hasNext()) {
            Student s = it.next();
            System.out.println(s);
        }

        System.out.println("----------------------");

        // å¢å¼ºforéå†
        for (Student s : list) {
            System.out.println(s);
        }
    }
}

                                      # 2.2. TreeSet

                                      ç‰¹ç‚¹

                                      • ä¸åŒ…å«é‡å¤å…ƒç´ çš„é›†åˆ

                                        @Override
public int compareTo(Student o){
    int result = this.age - o.age;
    return result;
}

                                      åŸç†

                                      • å¦‚æœè¿”å›å€¼ä¸ºè´Ÿæ•°ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºå½“å‰å­˜å…¥çš„å…ƒç´ æ˜¯è¾ƒå°å€¼ï¼Œå­˜å·¦è¾¹

                                      • é‡å†™æ–¹æ³•æ—¶ï¼Œä¸€å®šè¦æ³¨æ„æ’åºè§„åˆ™å¿…é¡»è¦æŒ‰ç…§è¦æ±‚çš„ä¸»è¦æ¡ä»¶å’Œæ¬¡è¦æ¡ä»¶æ¥å†™

                                        @Override
public int compare(Teacher o1, Teacher o2){
    // o1è¡¨ç¤ºç°åœ¨è¦å­˜å…¥çš„é‚£ä¸ªå…ƒç´ 
    // o2è¡¨ç¤ºå·²ç»å­˜å…¥åˆ°é›†åˆä¸­çš„å…ƒç´ 
    
    // ä¸»è¦æ¡ä»¶
    int result = o1.getAge() - o2.getAge();
    // æ¬¡è¦æ¡ä»¶
    result = result == 0 ? o1.getName().compareTo(o2.getName()) : result;
    return result;
}

                                      ä¸¤ç§æ¯”è¾ƒæ–¹å¼å°ç»“

                                      • è‡ªç„¶æ’åºï¼šè‡ªå®šä¹‰ç±»å®ç°Comparableæ¥å£ï¼Œé‡å†™compareToæ–¹æ³•ï¼Œæ ¹æ®è¿”å›å€¼è¿›è¡Œæ’åº
                                      • æ¯”è¾ƒå™¨æ’åºï¼šåˆ›å»ºTreeSetå¯¹è±¡çš„æ—¶å€™ä¼ é€’Comparatorçš„å®ç°ç±»å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œé‡å†™compareæ–¹æ³•ï¼Œæ ¹æ®è¿”å›å€¼è¿›è¡Œæ’åº
                                      • åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œé»˜è®¤ä½¿ç”¨è‡ªç„¶æ’åºï¼Œå½“è‡ªç„¶æ’åºä¸æ»¡è¶³ç°åœ¨çš„éœ€æ±‚æ—¶ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æ¯”è¾ƒæ’åº

                                      ç»ƒä¹ ï¼šåˆ›å»º3ä¸ªå­¦ç”Ÿå¯¹è±¡ï¼Œå±æ€§ä¸ºå§“åï¼Œè¯­æ•°è‹±æˆç»©ï¼ŒæŒ‰ç…§æ€»åˆ†ä»å°åˆ°å¤§é¡ºåºæ‰“å°åˆ°æ§åˆ¶å°

                                      // Studentç±»

public class Student implements Comparable<Student>{
	private String name;
	private int chinese;
	private int english;
	private int math;
	
	public Student(String name, int chinese, int english, int math) {
		super();
		this.name = name;
		this.chinese = chinese;
		this.english = english;
		this.math = math;
	}
	public Student() {
		super();
	}
	
	public String getName() {
		return name;
	}
	public void setName(String name) {
		this.name = name;
	}
	public int getChinese() {
		return chinese;
	}
	public void setChinese(int chinese) {
		this.chinese = chinese;
	}
	public int getEnglish() {
		return english;
	}
	public void setEnglish(int english) {
		this.english = english;
	}
	public int getMath() {
		return math;
	}
	public void setMath(int math) {
		this.math = math;
	}
	public int getSum(){
		int res;
		res = chinese + math + english;
		return res;
	}
	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "Student [name=" + name + ", chinese=" + chinese + ", english=" + english + ", math=" + math + "]" + "æ€»åˆ†ä¸ºï¼š" + getSum();
	}
	@Override
	public int compareTo(Student o) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		int res = this.getSum() - o.getSum();
		res = res == 0 ? this.getChinese() - o.getChinese() : res;
		res = res == 0 ? this.getMath() - o.getMath() : res;
		res = res == 0 ? this.getName().compareTo(o.getName()) : res;
		return res;
	}
}

import java.util.TreeSet;

public class Test {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub

		Student s1 = new Student("æå››", 80, 80, 80);
		Student s2 = new Student("å¼ ä¸‰", 80, 80, 80);
		Student s3 = new Student("ç‹äº”", 80, 80, 80);
		stu.add(s1);
		stu.add(s2);
		stu.add(s3);
		for(Student student : stu){
			System.out.println(student);
		}
	}
}

                                      # 2.3.3 HashSet

                                      ç‰¹ç‚¹

                                      import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Iterator;

//import java.util.TreeSet;

public class Hash {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		HashSet<String> hs = new HashSet<>();
		hs.add("hello");
		hs.add("world");
		hs.add("java");
		hs.add("java");
		hs.add("java");
		hs.add("java");
		
		Iterator<String> it = hs.iterator();
		while(it.hasNext()){
			String s = it.next();
			System.out.println(s);
		}
	}
}

                                      • Objectç±»ä¸­hashCodeæ–¹æ³•å¯ä»¥è·å–å¯¹è±¡çš„å“ˆå¸Œå€¼

                                      å¯¹è±¡çš„å“ˆå¸Œå€¼ç‰¹ç‚¹

                                      • åŒä¸€ä¸ªå¯¹è±¡å¤šæ¬¡è°ƒç”¨hashCode()æ–¹æ³•è¿”å›çš„å“ˆå¸Œå€¼æ˜¯ç›¸åŒçš„

                                      • ï¼ˆé”®+å€¼ï¼‰è¿™ä¸ªæ•´ä½“æˆ‘ä»¬ç§°ä¹‹ä¸ºâ€œé”®å€¼å¯¹â€ æˆ–è€…â€œé”®å€¼å¯¹å¯¹è±¡â€ï¼Œåœ¨Javaä¸­å«åšâ€œEntryå¯¹è±¡â€

                                        import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

public class Base {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		Map<String, String> stu = new HashMap<>();
		stu.put("2020033001", "å¼ ä¸‰");
		stu.put("2020033002", "æå››");
		stu.put("2020033003", "ç‹äº”");
		System.out.println(stu);
	}

                                      # 3.1. HashMap

                                      • HashMapæ˜¯Mapé‡Œé¢çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå®ç°ç±»ã€‚

                                      • æ²¡æœ‰é¢å¤–éœ€è¦å­¦ä¹ çš„ç‰¹æœ‰æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨Mapé‡Œé¢çš„æ–¹æ³•å°±å¯ä»¥äº†

                                      • HashMapå’ŒHashSetçš„åº•å±‚åŸç†éƒ½æ˜¯å“ˆå¸Œè¡¨ç»“æ„

                                      • ä¾èµ–hashCodeæ–¹æ³•å’Œequalsæ–¹æ³•ä¿è¯é”®çš„å”¯ä¸€

                                      • å¦‚æœé”®è¦å­˜å‚¨çš„æ˜¯è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œéœ€è¦é‡å†™hashCodeå’Œequalsæ–¹æ³•

                                      æ¡ˆä¾‹ï¼šåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªHashMapé›†åˆï¼Œé”®æ˜¯å­¦ç”Ÿå¯¹è±¡ï¼ˆStudentï¼‰ï¼Œå€¼æ˜¯ç±è´¯ï¼ˆStringï¼‰ã€‚å­˜å‚¨ä¸‰ä¸ªé”®å€¼å¯¹å…ƒç´ ï¼Œå¹¶éå†

                                      // Studentç±»

public class Student {
	private String name;
	private int age;
	
	public Student() {
		super();
	}

	public Student(String name, int age) {
		super();
		this.name = name;
		this.age = age;
	}

	public String getName() {
		return name;
	}

	public void setName(String name) {
		this.name = name;
	}

	public int getAge() {
		return age;
	}

	public void setAge(int age) {
		this.age = age;
	}

	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "Student [name=" + name + ", age=" + age + "]";
	}

	@Override
	public int hashCode() {
		final int prime = 31;
		int result = 1;
		result = prime * result + age;
		result = prime * result + ((name == null) ? 0 : name.hashCode());
		return result;
	}

	@Override
	public boolean equals(Object obj) {
		if (this == obj)
			return true;
		if (obj == null)
			return false;
		if (getClass() != obj.getClass())
			return false;
		Student other = (Student) obj;
		if (age != other.age)
			return false;
		if (name == null) {
			if (other.name != null)
				return false;
		} else if (!name.equals(other.name))
			return false;
		return true;
	}
}

                                      // å®ç°ç±»

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Set;
import java.util.Map;

public class HashDemo {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		HashMap<Student,String> hm = new HashMap<>();
		Student s1 = new Student("å¼ ä¸‰",23);
		Student s2 = new Student("æå››",22);
		Student s3 = new Student("ç‹äº”",22);
		hm.put(s1, "æ±Ÿè‹");
		hm.put(s2, "è¥¿å®‰");
		hm.put(s3, "åŒ—äº¬");
		
		// éå†æ–¹å¼ä¸€ï¼šè·å–æ‰€æœ‰çš„é”®ï¼Œå†æ‰¾å¯¹åº”çš„å€¼
		Set<Student> keys = hm.keySet();
		for(Student key : keys){
			String value = hm.get(key);
			System.out.println(key + "------" + value);
		}
		System.out.println("====================");
		
		// éå†æ–¹å¼äºŒï¼šå…ˆè·å–åˆ°æ‰€æœ‰çš„é”®å€¼å¯¹å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œå†è·å–åˆ°é‡Œé¢çš„æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªé”®å’Œå€¼
		Set<Map.Entry<Student, String>> entries = hm.entrySet();
		for(Map.Entry<Student, String> entry: entries){
			Student key = entry.getKey();
			String value = entry.getValue();
			System.out.println(key + "------" + value);
		}
		System.out.println("====================");
		
		// éå†æ–¹å¼ä¸‰ï¼š
		hm.forEach(
				(Student key, String value)->{
					System.out.println(key + "-----" + value);
				}
		);
	}
}

                                      # 3.2. TreeMap

                                      • TreeMapæ˜¯Mapé‡Œé¢çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå®ç°ç±»

                                      • æ²¡æœ‰é¢å¤–éœ€è¦å­¦ä¹ çš„ç‰¹æœ‰æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨Mapé‡Œé¢çš„æ–¹æ³•å°±å¯ä»¥äº†

                                      • TreeMapå’ŒTreeSetä¸€æ ·ï¼Œåº•å±‚éƒ½æ˜¯çº¢é»‘æ ‘ç»“æ„çš„

                                      • ä¾èµ–è‡ªç„¶æ’åºæˆ–è€…æ¯”è¾ƒå™¨æ’åºï¼Œå¯¹é”®è¿›è¡Œæ’åº

                                      • å¦‚æœé”®å­˜å‚¨çš„æ˜¯è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œéœ€è¦å®ç°Comparableæ¥å£æˆ–è€…åœ¨åˆ›å»ºTreeMapå¯¹è±¡æ—¶ä¾¯ç»™å‡ºæ¯”è¾ƒå™¨æ’åºè§„åˆ™

                                      ç»ƒä¹ ï¼šåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªTreeMapé›†åˆï¼Œé”®æ˜¯å­¦ç”Ÿå¯¹è±¡ï¼ˆStudentï¼‰ï¼Œå€¼æ˜¯ç±è´¯ï¼ˆStringï¼‰

                                      â€‹ å­¦ç”Ÿå±æ€§å§“åå’Œå¹´é¾„ï¼ŒæŒ‰ç…§å¹´é¾„è¿›è¡Œæ’åºå¹¶éå†

                                      // Studentç±»
public class Student implements Comparable<Student>{
	private String name;
	private int age;
	
	public Student() {
		super();
	}

	public Student(String name, int age) {
		super();
		this.name = name;
		this.age = age;
	}

	public String getName() {
		return name;
	}

	public void setName(String name) {
		this.name = name;
	}

	public int getAge() {
		return age;
	}

	public void setAge(int age) {
		this.age = age;
	}

	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "Student [name=" + name + ", age=" + age + "]";
	}

	@Override
	public int compareTo(Student o){
		// æŒ‰ç…§å¹´é¾„è¿›è¡Œæ’åº
		int result = this.getAge() - o.getAge();
		// æ¬¡è¦æ¡ä»¶ï¼ŒæŒ‰ç…§å§“åæ’åº
		result = result == 0 ? this.getName().compareTo(o.getName()) : result;
		return result;
    }
}

                                      // å®ç°ç±»
import java.util.TreeMap;
public class TreeMapTest {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		TreeMap<Student, String> tm = new TreeMap<>();
		
		Student s1 = new Student("å¼ ä¸‰",23);
		Student s2 = new Student("æå››",22);
		Student s3 = new Student("ç‹äº”",22);
		
		tm.put(s1, "æ±Ÿè‹");
		tm.put(s2, "åŒ—äº¬");
		tm.put(s3, "å¤©æ´¥");
		
		tm.forEach(
				(Student key, String value)->{
					System.out.println(key + "----" + value);
				}
		);
    }
}

public static void main(String[] args){
    int[] arr = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
    int sum1 = getSum(arr);
    System.out.println(sum1);
}
public static int getSum(int[] arr){
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++){
        sum += arr[i];
    }
    return sum;
}

public static int getSum(int...arr){
    int sum = 0;

        sum += arr[i];

                                      ç°åœ¨æœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªArrayListé›†åˆï¼Œåˆ†åˆ«å­˜å‚¨6åç”·æ¼”å‘˜å’Œ6åå¥³æ¼”å‘˜ï¼Œè¦æ±‚å®Œæˆä»¥ä¸‹æ“ä½œ

                                      package Stream;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.stream.Stream;

public class Demo{
    public static void main(String[] args){
        ArrayList<String> manList = new ArrayList<>();
        manList.add("å¼ å›½ç«‹");
        manList.add("å¼ æ™‹");
        manList.add("åˆ˜çƒ¨");
        manList.add("éƒ‘å°¹å¥");
        manList.add("å¾å³¥");
        manList.add("ç‹å®å¼º");
        ArrayList<String> womanList = new ArrayList<>();
        womanList.add("æ¨ç´«");
        womanList.add("å…³æ™“å½¤");
        womanList.add("å¼ å¤©çˆ±");
        womanList.add("æ¨å¹‚");
        womanList.add("èµµä¸½é¢–");
        
        Stream<String> stream1 = manList.stream().filter(name -> name.length() == 3).limit(2);
        
        Stream<String> stream2 = womanList.stream().filter(name -> name.startsWith("æ¨")).skip(1);
        
        Stream.concat(stream1, stream2).forEach(name -> System.out.println(name));;
    }
}
